alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 16 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WIND GUSTS AND AREAS OF BLOWING SNOW LIKELY FOR THE ANCHORAGE HILLSIDE THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING. WIDESPREAD SNOW FOR THE ANCHORAGE BOWL SATURDAY NIGHT... Southeasterly winds will develop this morning along Turnagain Arm and across the Anchorage Hillside and increase through this afternoon. These winds will peak in intensity this evening with sustained winds of 30 to 45 mph and gusts to 65 mph. The strongest wind gusts are expected on the Anchorage Hillside. Localized areas of blowing snow are likely with these gusty winds. Winds will then quickly diminish and shift to the southwest as a frontal system moves through. The shift in winds will also allow snow to develop across the Anchorage Bowl. 2 to 4 inches of snow, with locally higher amounts, are possible Saturday night through early Sunday morning. Southerly wind gusts to 25 mph may cause localized areas of blowing and drifting snow across the Anchorage Bowl Sunday.
